benchmark_details.name: MMS EARCH
benchmark_details.overview: MMS EARCH is a comprehensive evaluation benchmark designed to assess the multimodal search performance of Large Multimodal Models (LMMs). It categorizes searching queries into two primary areas: News and Knowledge, encompassing 300 manually collected instances across 14 subfields, with no overlap with LMMs’ training data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of LMMs in multimodal search capabilities through a structured pipeline that includes requerying, reranking, and summarization tasks.

data.source: 300 manually collected instances covering 14 subfields, ensuring no overlap with LMMs’ training data.
data.annotation: Manual collection and categorization by annotators.

methodology.calculation: The final score is derived from the weighted outcomes of the end-to-end task and individual tasks (requery, rerank, and summarization).
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better multimodal search capabilities across utilized LMMs.
methodology.validation: Evaluation covers closed-source and open-source LMMs through extensive experiments.
